sen.e: It seems that shio-konbu boiled with soy sauce was cooked using L. religiosa in the Sengoku period (period of warring states), which was served in the ceremony to go into a battle as lucky foods along with dried chestnut, because the sound of konbu (kelp) made people think of joy (joy is "yoro-kobu" in Japanese, "yoro-kobu" and "yoro-konbu" have similar sounds) and dried chestnut made them think of victory (dried chestnut is called "kachi-guri" (literally, victory and chestnut) in Japanese).

sen.e: The name 'shiofuki-konbu' was applied to the processed foods made from shio-konbu boiled with soy sauce, which received the procedures three times of drying on the hibachi (brazier) using a wire grill and dip in soy sauce.

The name 'shiofuki-konbu' was applied to the processed foods made from shio-konbu boiled with soy sauce, which received the procedures as follows: Drying on the hibachi (brazier) using a wire grill for three times while dipping in soy sauce each time after drying.
sen.cmt: 全体的に修正しました。

sen.j: 粉が表面に吹いているように見える。
sen.e: The surface may look powdery.

sen.j: これは昆布のうまみ成分が結晶化したものである。
sen.e: This powder like material is the crystallized umami constituents.

sen.j: 現在では、イノシン酸や昆布のグルタミン成分などの調味料をまぶす場合もある。

tit.j: 発酵食品分野に昆布が登場
tit.e: Kelp is also used in the field of fermented foods.

Use in the field of fermented foods

sen.j: 近年、発酵食品のひとつに発酵塩昆布が考案された。
sen.e: Fermented salty kelp was designed these days, counted among fermented food.
Fermented salty kelp was made these days, counted among fermented food.
Fermented salty kelp was invented recently as part of fermented food.

sen.j: もともと、昆布には硫酸基をもつ物質が含まれており、菌の繁殖を妨げていた。
sen.e: A substance equipped with a sulfate radical is originally contained in kelp, which prevents germs from breeding.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: A substance equipped with a sulfate radical is originally contained in kelp, which prevents germs from breeding.
A substance equipped with a sulfate radical is originally contained in kelp, which prevents the growth of bacteria.
sen.cmt: germs from breeding→ the growth of bacteria

sen.j: この硫酸基に影響を受けずに昆布を発酵させる菌が海底生物から見つかった。
sen.e: However, a germ was discovered from the benthic feeder, which had the capability to ferment kelp without being influenced by the sulfate radical contained in kelp.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: このために発酵塩昆布の開発に拍車がかかった。
sen.e: This discovery accelerated the development of the fermented salty kelp.

sen.e: This discovery accelerated the development of the fermented salty kelp.

sen.j: 昆布を発酵させる技術は、宝ホールディングス、協和発酵キリン、こうはら本店がそれぞれ独創的な技術を持つ。
sen.e: TAKARA HOLDINGS INC., Kyowa Hakko Kirin Co., Ltd. and Kohara Honten Corporation have their own original technology for fermenting kelp.

sen.j: 天然酵母が育てた塩昆布「舞昆」という新しい発酵食品を開発した「こうはら本店」は食品昆布発酵技術の先駆けである。
sen.e: Kohara Honten Corporation is a pioneer in the ferment technology of kelp, which developed a new fermented food called 'Maikon,' shio-konbu fostered by natural yeasts.

sen.j: サントリーが、岸田綱太郎博士の乳酸菌技術を使った、昆布発酵健康食品を製品化に成功した。

sen.j: 発酵昆布には、血中のコレステロールを低下させる効果が発表されている。

sen.j: 乾燥した昆布は水分を吸収すると膨張するという性質をもつ。

sen.j: この性質を利用して、医療用拡張器の原材料として昆布が利用される。
sen.e: For this property, kelp is used as a raw material to produce the medical dilator.
